page.title: 13Activities in West Ashby.
page.content: The only active society in the village is the Women's Institute. This was started by Mrs.Ethel Achurch in 1946. The first meeting was held in a room at the Vicarage,with about 20 members. 4/5 years were spent in a nissen hut in the grounds of the Manor.They then moved to the school.When by public subscription the Village Hall was built in 1958,they moved again.Member -ship is 40 this year (1985) but 3/4 of the members come from outside the village.For the past 6 years the Village Hall Committee and the P.C.C. have run an Autumn vegetable show,with classes for fruit,vegetables,flowers and cookery.Children's classes are included.Two domino teams and a darts team are run in local leagues by The Green Dragon pub.
